review: Even the TV ads don't show you that there is a corded AC adapter that must plug into the wall and attach to the USB insert.  My 60" TV hangs on the wall with the wires behind the wall.  It is all set.  The TV is awkward and heavy to lift when your arms are spread that far out.  I don't want to mess with my TV now it is mounted.  Watch the commercial and it says just plug in the USB insert and away you go.  NOT SO!!!  It was a bear running the wire behind the wall the first time and I don't want to do it again.  I also doubt that the cord was long enough for my needs.  What I can't understand is that most USB's get their power from the TV or computer, like a mouse or keyboard does.  Why didn't they engineer this that way?

review: Poorly designed UI for app navigation. Routinely droped network (my router was 18" away and signal strength was very strong). HDCP unauthorized message was displayed near daily. Stuttered when using Netflix. Image froze many times when using HuluPlus. Amazon is capable of so much more - this thing felt like a rush job.  I only paid $19 and didn't feel it was worth that so I returned my Fire TV Stick.
